meanings.definition: To pierce in order to draw off liquid
meanings.sent1: She broached the keg to pour some refreshing soda.
meanings.sent2: The plumber broached the pipe to fix the leak.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty traveler broached the watermelon to quench his thirst.
meanings.sent4: The needle broached the skin, releasing a small drop of blood.
meanings.sent5: The straw broached the juice box, causing a spill on the table.

meanings.definition: To open up for the first time
meanings.sent1: The explorer broached the ancient tomb, revealing hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: The chef broached the recipe book to try a new dish.
meanings.sent3: The child broached the gift box with excitement, finding a toy inside.
meanings.sent4: The sun broached the horizon, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The locksmith broached the old chest, discovering valuable documents inside.

meanings.definition: To introduce a topic for discussion
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, she broached the idea of a team retreat.
meanings.sent2: He broached the subject of budget cuts during the staff meeting.
meanings.sent3: The student broached the topic of a class pet, sparking a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The politician broached the issue of healthcare reform in his speech.
meanings.sent5: The teacher broached the concept of empathy, encouraging students to discuss its importance.
